page.title: 15Ashurst: occupations
page.content: In a survey of the nineteen children in Ashurst School's junior class: 18 fathers were in work. Only one worked in Ashurst. 11 mothers worked, all except the farmer's wife, worked out of the area. Only 6 of the children lived in the village and except for the 6 council houses the property prices in Ashurst are too expensive for anyone who works in Ashurst to afford. Except for a small cottage industry- of a rather 'upmarket' kind, the only work in Ashurst is the pub or farming. The rest of the fathers travel to Crawley, Horsham, Worthing or Shoreham.
